basic_info.description: I am DeShon Dixon. US Army Veteran transitioning into software development. The transition into Software development has been hard but the life I've lived has been harder. I have chosen to transition into software development because I wanted a career where my work is meaningful and I can see the results of my hard work. I have struggled financially my whole life and it has fueled my drive throughout this transition. I know a career in software development would allow me to break the cycle and elevate me to a better position in life. I'm tired of just being another body at a job and easily expendable. Switching to a career in software development is my first time doing something I want to do in life. I've had nothing but dead end jobs other than the military. The military was a stepping stone for me to get out of the position I was in life and give me a chance I would've never otherwise had. The experience I've gained while in the military has instilled the ability to adapt in self-starting and collaborative environments.

projects.title: Animal Shelter
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
